#Summary1=(human1) With the development of its Internet Explorer 9 almost complete and stiff competition from Mozilla Firefox, Safari and Chrome, Microsoft has started a campaign to persuade users to stop using its older browser, the highly successful but now obsolete IE6, which they no longer want to support.

#Summary2=(claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022) Microsoft has launched an aggressive campaign to phase out Internet Explorer 6, its decade-old browser with numerous security vulnerabilities, as IE's market share drops and newer browsers gain popularity.

#Summary3=(gpt4o) Microsoft has launched “The Internet Explorer 6 Countdown,” a campaign urging users to transition from the outdated Internet Explorer 6 to newer versions, aiming to reduce its usage to below one percent due to the browser's declining market share, compatibility issues with modern web standards, and significant security vulnerabilities.

#Summary4=(Llama-3.2-3B-Instruct) Microsoft is ending support for Internet Explorer 6, a 10-year-old browser, and is urging users to upgrade to newer versions, such as Internet Explorer 9, due to its declining market share and security vulnerabilities.
#Summary5=(Qwen2.5-7B-Instruct) Microsoft is pushing users to abandon the outdated and insecure Internet Explorer 6 in favor of more modern and secure browsers like IE9, Firefox, and Chrome.
#Text=Microsoft waits for death of Internet Explorer 6
#Text=Tuesday , March 8 , 2011

#Text=With development of Microsoft 's Internet Explorer 9 ( IE9 ) browser almost complete , Microsoft announced on Friday that it is time for IE6 users to move away from the antiquated 10 - year - old browser .
#Text=Microsoft has replaced it with three newer versions .
#Text=On a new website , " The Internet Explorer 6 Countdown " , Microsoft has launched an aggressive campaign to persuade users to stop using IE6 and update to a newer IE .

#Text=PC World 's recent analysis of its own web traffic statistics concluded ,  Usually , Internet Explorer is the # 2 browser after Firefox , but over the past 30 days it 's been # 3 , a couple of points behind Safari - and nearly tied with Chrome .

column1: #Text=The Internet security firm Secunia.com , has said that as of March 4 , 2011 , IE6 has 277 vulnerabilities ; 39 percent of these are rated " highly critical " .
#Text=Microsoft says that the latest versions of Internet Explorer provide the user with enhanced protection from these attacks and threats .
#Text=Microsoft 's Internet Explorer 6 is one of the most successful software products ever as measured by its durability and the massive numbers of people who have used it .
#Text=IE6 shipped with Windows XP , nearly a decade ago .
#Text=But it has outlived its usefulness , and Microsoft no longer wants to support it .
